org.openimaj.demos.sandbox.video

Class FaceShotTypeAnnotator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.video.Video<T>
      • org.openimaj.video.processor.VideoProcessor<T>
        • org.openimaj.demos.sandbox.video.VideoAnnotator<MBFImage,String>
          • org.openimaj.demos.sandbox.video.FaceShotTypeAnnotator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, Iterable<MBFImage>

    public class FaceShotTypeAnnotator
extends VideoAnnotator<MBFImage,String>
    Uses a tracker (CLMFaceTracker) to track the face in the frame and determine whether the face stays within certain size boundaries to determine shot type.

    The shot types detected are:

    • Close Up: The face fills the frame - that is, it takes between 12% or more of the frame.
    • Medium Close Up: The person is filmed head-and-shoulders - that is, the face takes up between 3% and 12% of the frame.
    • Mid-Shot: The person is filmed half-body or less - that is, the face takes up between 0% and 3% of the frame.
    • Two-Shot: If there are two people in the frame.
    • Group-Shot: If there are more than two people in the frame.

    If the tracker loses track of any of the faces, then the face is removed from the set that is used to produce the annotations.

    The cumulative moving average is used to store the size of each face during the tracking of the faces.

    The CLMFaceTracker is also able to provide pose information about the subject. From this we are able to determine some extra annotations about the subject - such as whether they appear to be talking to an off-screen person (interviewee or interviewer), or talking to the camera (presenter or anchor).

    Version:
    $Author$, $Revision$, $Date$
    Author:
    David Dupplaw (dpd@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

      • processFrame

        public MBFImage processFrame(MBFImage frame)
        Process a frame in this video. The processor must determine itself what is to be done with the frame that is processed. It is suggest that subclass processors add listeners for processed frames if they are required. The implementation must process the frame in-place and the frame should be returned.
        Specified by:
        processFrame in class VideoProcessor<MBFImage>
        Parameters:
        frame - The frame to process.
        Returns:
        the processed frame
        See Also:
        VideoProcessor.processFrame(org.openimaj.image.Image)

      • updateAnnotations

        protected void updateAnnotations()
        Update the annotations list. The annotations member is a Set, so you should be able to add annotations without being concerned about duplicates, as long as the ANNOTATION type is Comparable.
        Overrides:
        updateAnnotations in class VideoAnnotator<MBFImage,String>
